item.title: Water runoff causing ice hazard, 7th January
item.description:
Water runs down this hill constantly. It appears to be run off from the hill so it's been pretty much constant for the last year at least. In mild weather this is a nuisance, but in icy weather not only is water running onto the a40 and causing icy slush, but the road down to the junction is a skating rink. It's a matter of time before someone either skids off the road or skids onto the a40 and into traffic.. A sign warning off ice is completely insufficient, the drainage needs to be diverted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Posts holding a very large blue Highways sign snapped off has snapped off its, 7th January
item.description:
This has already been reported as Report 22066364. BUT the location originally given was incorrect . What3Words location is ///wanted.tricky.wonderfully left side of A40 going down into Cheltenham, just before the Dowdeswell left turn. The sign is a huge one, the poles holding it have snapped off.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A huge crater in the road!!!, 7th January
item.description:
This is a huge crater in the road on left side as you travel from Birdlip roundabout, my car actually went down it this eve and the front skirt of car scraped the crater as it came out causing damage, I’m feeling so angry about it. The only way to use this part of the road is either to travel down the centre of it or drive very slowly causing aggressive drivers behind. I use this road five days a week and am so fed up of it to be honest, it is an absolute nightmare driving home in the dark as I’m going like a snail looking for the potholes, and trying to avoid them. This is not the first time I have complained. The left hand side of the road is falling apart and not fit for purpose. A death trap. PLEASE WILL YOU DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT AND NOT JUST ANOTHER BODGE IT JOB
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30mph sign on entrance to Birdlip village from A417 rusted through now lying on pavement. The stump of the post in the pavement is jagged and could cause serious injury to pedestrians., 7th January
item.description:
B4070 from A417 on entrance to Birdlip village 30mph sign rusted through and now lying on pavement. Remains of post has jagged edges with potential of serious injury to pedestrians. Urgent attention required asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
